extendedIngredients.name: fusilli pasta
extendedIngredients.original: 1/2 pound pasta such as fusilli, quadrefiore or radiatore
extendedIngredients.originalName: pasta such as fusilli, quadrefiore or radiatore

extendedIngredients.name: olive oil
extendedIngredients.original: 1/3 cup plus 1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil

extendedIngredients.name: tuna
extendedIngredients.original: 1 jar (8 to 10 ounces) imported tuna packed in olive oil, drained and broken into large chunks with a fork
extendedIngredients.originalName: jar imported tuna packed in olive oil, drained and broken into large chunks with a fork

extendedIngredients.name: water chestnuts

title: Tuna With Pasta And Frisée
summary: Tuna With Pastan And Frisée might be just the main course you are searching for. This recipe makes 4 servings with 518 calories, 26g of protein, and 24g of fat each. For $2.02 per serving, this recipe covers 31% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 1 person has tried and liked this recipe. Head to the store and pick up water chestnuts, pasta such as fusilli, lemon juice, and a few other things to make it today. It is a good option if you're following a dairy free and pescatarian diet. With a spoonacular score of 91%, this dish is spectacular. Similar recipes include Chiocciole with Tuna, Red Onions, and Frisee, Bacon-Wrapped Tuna Steaks with Frisée and Avocado Salad, and Pastan and Tuna Salad (Ensalada de Pasta y Atún).

winePairing.pairingText: Tuna works really well with Merlot, Pinot Noir, and rosé Wine. Though fish is often paired with white wine, 'meatier' fish like tuna can absolutely go with red wine. A Rosé will also pair nicely, particularly if your tunan is prepared with ingredients better suited to a white wine. The Goldschmidt Vineyard Alexander Valley Chelsea Merlot with a 4.8 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 20 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Goldschmidt Vineyard Alexander Valley Chelsea Merlot
productMatches.description: Beautiful red raspberry, black cherry, and spice aromas. Full and round with plum, red currant, blackberry, and bay leaf flavors. The soft tannins give this wine a velvety smoothness and the chocolatey finish just goes on and on.

instructions: In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook the pasta until al dente. Drain well and toss with 1 tablespoon of the extra-virgin olive oil.                                              In a saucepan of boiling salted water, blanch the water chestnuts for 1 minute. Drain and slice 1/4 inch thick.                                              In a large bowl, mix the remaining 1/3 cup of olive oil with the scallions, lemon juice and garlic. Season with salt and pepper. Add the pasta, frise, tuna and the water chestnuts or apple; toss well and serve.

steps.step: In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook the pasta until al dente.
Drain well and toss with 1 tablespoon of the extra-virgin olive oil.
In a saucepan of boiling salted water, blanch the water chestnuts for 1 minute.
In a large bowl, mix the remaining 1/3 cup of olive oil with the scallions, lemon juice and garlic. Season with salt and pepper.
Add the pasta, frise, tuna and the water chestnuts or apple; toss well and serve.
